# modelimportance

The goal of modelimportance is to â€¦

## Installation

You can install the development version of modelimportance from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("mkim425/modelimportance")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

``` r
library(modelimportance)
## basic example code
```

# Package index

## All functions

- [`compute_importance()`](https://mkim425.github.io/modelimportance/reference/compute_importance.md)
  : Calculate model importance for a single task

- [`model_importance()`](https://mkim425.github.io/modelimportance/reference/model_importance.md)
  : Quantifies the contribution of ensemble component models to ensemble
  prediction accuracy for each prediction task.

- [`model_importance_summary()`](https://mkim425.github.io/modelimportance/reference/model_importance_summary.md)
  :

  Summarize model importance scores produced by
  [`model_importance()`](https://mkim425.github.io/modelimportance/reference/model_importance.md)
  across tasks

- [`split_data_by_task()`](https://mkim425.github.io/modelimportance/reference/split_data_by_task.md)
  : Split the input data by a single task and make a list of data sets

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [\`modelimportance\`: Assessing Model Contribution to Ensemble
  Accuracy](https://mkim425.github.io/modelimportance/articles/modelimportance.md):
